@app.post("/generate")
def generate(r: Req):
style_clause = (
"Respond in a guilt-jtripping, heartfelt apolo
if r.mode.lower() == “apology”
else "Respond in a neutral, believable tone."

)

full_prompt = (
f"{SYSTEM_PROMPT}\nTone: {style_clause}\n"
f"Scenario: {r.scenario}\nUrgency: {r.urgency

)

messages = [
SystemMessage(content=SYSTEM_PROMPT) ,
HumanMessage(content=full_prompt)

]

Expanding modes (totally optional)

Because the code just checks r.mode.lower() == "apology", you can easily add more tones with a small mapping table:
Suggested mode Prompt clause example Use-case

"humorous" “Respond in a lighthearted, witty style.” Friendly/social excuses
"professional" “Use formal business language, keep it concise.” Work email excuses
"Sarcastic" “Answer with dry sarcasm; keep it short.” Fun demo / joking
"emergency" “Sound panicked and extremely urgent; max 20 words.” Pair with urgency="panic"

How to add one (example for "humorous"):
python ©) Copy

tone_map = {
"normal": "Respond in a neutral, believable tone.",
"apology": "Respond in a guilt-tripping, heartfelt apology tone.",
"humorous": "Respond in a lighthearted, witty style.",

}

style_clause = tone_map.get(r.mode.lower(), tone_map["normal"])

Then callers can send:
